page.title: 02PORT OF MENTEITH CHURCH
page.content: The Port of Menteith church belongs to the Presbyterian Church of Scotland and its minister is responsible for the Parish. The present building was erected in 1878 on the site of an earlier building and it is thought that this has been the site of a church since long before the Reformation.It is situated on the eastern shore of the Lake of Menteith and is a well-known landmark.It is particularly attractive as seen from the road from Callander as one comes over Cockhill and sees the Lake spread out before one's gaze.The old grey sandstone building with its small spire seems to nestle so comfortably by the curve of the Lake. There are some very old tombstones in the churchyard some dating from 1600.
